# References

## Academic Literature

Full academic references are provided in the [references document](../references/REFERENCES.md).

Key papers cited in this analysis:

### Stadium Economics
- Noll (1974): Ticket demand elasticity -0.49
- Scully (1989): Ticket demand elasticity -0.63 to -0.76
- Krautmann & Berri (2007): Concessions elasticity, complementarity
- Coates & Humphreys (2007): Joint ticket-concession optimization

### Alcohol Externalities
- Manning et al. (1991): External costs $0.48-$1.19/drink (1986 dollars)
- Carpenter & Dobkin (2015): Crime elasticities (assault, rape)
- Rees & Schnepel (2009): Football games and crime
- Lenk et al. (2010): Stadium alcohol policies

### Tax Policy
- Parry et al. (2009): Fiscal and externality rationales
- Gruber & KÃ¶szegi (2001): Rational addiction
- Cook & Moore (2000): Alcohol economics

## Data Sources

- **Prices**: Team Marketing Report, StubHub, industry sources (2025)
- **Taxes**: TTB, NY Dept of Taxation, NYC Finance
- **Attendance**: MLB official statistics
- **Consumption**: Lenk et al. (2010) survey data
